intro: Melianthus dregeanus subsp. insignis, commonly known as the red milkweed tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting a variety of pollinators. The plant has compound leaves with long, slender leaflets and produces capsules that contain numerous small, hairy seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
